attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
After the 50th anniversary of the Modern computer it would be nice to have a tribute to the man who started it all.

After Alan Turing created the Manchester baby and the Manchester mark one this country let him down just because of his sexual orientation.

Why not make a tribute to the man? The only tribute we have is a statue of him holding an apple! Lets have a Computer museum in Manchester. This would be great for education as computers are playing a huge role in our day to day lives! This could even attract all sorts of big names to the city as the computer industry has to be one of thee biggest industries in the world!
There is an endless list of companies that would be interested in such a scheme!

As there are few museums in Manchester I think this would be a great way to celebrate the anniversary of the modern computer and I believe it would be a fantastic tribute to Alan Turing.

rejection.details:
Hi Paul, petitions need to have an action rather than a statement in the title. For example, "create a new museum to mark the anniversary" rather than just "New-Museum". 

In this instance the petition is also outside the remit or Government. We suggest you approach your council or a Computer organisation instead.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
